title: Madhubani Art
short: Originating in Bihar, uses natural dyes and depicts folklore and deities in bold colors.
steps: Prepare the surface (paper or cloth) with a coat of natural gesso or a light wash.
Draw outlines using a fine nib pen or twig dipped in ink, focusing on geometric and symbolic patterns.
Fill areas with bold natural pigments or acrylics.
Add fine detailing using intricate borders, flowers, animals, and patterns.
Allow to dry and optionally apply a protective varnish.

title: Warli Art
short: A tribal art form from Maharashtra using white motifs on earthen backgrounds to portray daily life.
steps: Prepare a mud-brown background using soil and binder or brown paint.
Use simple shapes like circles, triangles, and squares to form figures.
Paint scenes of everyday life using white pigment made from rice paste.
Add repetitive patterns‚Äîtrees, animals, huts‚Äîto fill the space.
Dry completely and frame or mount the artwork.

title: Jaipur Blue Pottery
short: Unique to Rajasthan; known for its smooth blue-glazed finish made from quartz and minerals.
steps: Prepare the ceramic dough from quartz, fuller's earth, and adhesive materials.
Mold or press the pottery shape and let it semi-dry.
Apply a base white slip and sketch floral or geometric patterns.
Paint designs using cobalt blue and mineral pigments.
Glaze and fire at low temperature for the signature smooth finish.

title: Gond Art
short: A tribal art from Madhya Pradesh featuring animals, trees and nature using dots and lines.
steps: Lightly sketch the main shapes‚Äîanimals, trees, or natural elements.
Outline using black ink or paint.
Fill the interior using repeated dots, dashes, and line patterns.
Use contrasting bright colors to create texture and movement.
Add fine detailing and allow it to dry.

title: Kalamkari Art
short: A pen-drawn textile art from Andhra Pradesh using natural dyes and mythological themes.
steps: Prepare cotton fabric by washing and treating with natural mordants.
Use a bamboo 'kalam' (pen) to outline figures and borders.
Fill areas with natural dyes made from plants and minerals.
Add detailing with fine strokes and repeating motifs.
Wash and dry the cloth to fix the colors.

title: Pattachitra
short: A traditional cloth-based scroll painting from Odisha known for bold lines and intricate borders.
steps: Prepare cloth with chalk powder and gum to make a smooth surface.
Sketch mythological scenes with bold black outlines.
Fill with natural stone-based colors in flat tones.
Add intricate patterned borders around the main theme.
Polish with lacquer for protection.

title: Tanjore Painting
short: A classical South Indian painting form featuring gold relief work and deity figures.
steps: Prepare a wooden base with cloth and chalk paste.
Sketch deity figures and decorative borders.
Apply embossed areas using a paste of chalk and gum.
Fix gold foil over the embossed regions.
Paint remaining areas with rich colors and add detailing.

title: Phad Painting
short: A long-scroll storytelling art form from Rajasthan depicting folk tales of Pabuji and Devnarayan.
steps: Treat cloth with wheat flour paste and burnish for smoothness.
Sketch narrative scenes along the length of the scroll.
Paint flat areas using bright earthy colors.
Add expressive faces and fine line detailing.
Finish with borders and allow to dry fully.

title: Cheriyal Scroll Painting
short: A folk art from Telangana featuring bold, cartoon-like characters in storytelling scrolls.
steps: Prepare a canvas using tamarind paste and chalk powder.
Sketch characters with bold outlines.
Fill with bright primary colors.
Add expressive facial features and ornamentation.
Frame sections with decorative borders.

title: Indian Miniature Painting
short: Highly detailed paintings from Mughal and Rajput courts featuring royal scenes and nature.
steps: Prepare handmade paper or treated sheet.
Sketch extremely fine outlines with a thin brush.
Fill with mineral-based colors in layers.
Add micro-level ornamentation and background detailing.
Burnish with a smooth stone for sheen.

title: Channapatna Toys
short: Eco-friendly wooden toys from Karnataka made using natural dyes and lacquer polishing.
steps: Carve shapes from locally available softwood.
Mount wooden pieces on a lathe machine.
Shape using chisels and smooth the surface.
Apply natural dyes and lacquer for shine.
Assemble parts to complete the toy.

title: Dhokra Metal Casting
short: A tribal metal craft using lost-wax casting to create rustic figurines and ornaments.
steps: Shape the core model with clay.
Apply a wax layer and carve details into the wax.
Cover the model with clay and create drainage channels.
Melt the wax so metal can replace it.
Break the mold to reveal the final metal piece.

title: Bidriware
short: A black metal craft from Karnataka with intricate silver inlay designs.
steps: Cast the base object using zinc and copper alloy.
Polish the surface smooth for engraving.
Carve intricate patterns by hand.
Hammer thin silver wires into the grooves.
Apply a special soil paste to turn the surface deep black.

title: Kanchipuram Silk Weaving
short: Luxurious South Indian silk known for temple borders and gold zari weaving.
steps: Dye raw silk threads in vibrant colors.
Warp and prepare the loom setup.
Hand-weave body, border, and pallu separately.
Integrate zari work for patterns.
Join sections using the korvai technique.

title: Banarasi Brocade Weaving
short: Rich brocade fabric from Varanasi with gold and silver zari floral motifs.
steps: Prepare silk yarn through dyeing and drying.
Design motifs using traditional graph paper.
Set up the jacquard loom for weaving patterns.
Weave body fabric with zari threads.
Cut, finish, and polish the final saree.

title: Ikat Weaving
short: Tie-dye resist weaving technique where threads are dyed before weaving to form patterns.
steps: Tie sections of yarn tightly to resist dye.
Dye the yarn in sequential colors.
Prepare warp and weft threads on the loom.
Align dyed threads to match the pattern.
Hand-weave the cloth with precision.

title: Kutch Embroidery
short: Colorful Gujarati embroidery featuring mirrors, bold stitches, and geometric motifs.
steps: Select bright colored threads and fabric.
Sketch basic motifs using chalk.
Use interlaced and herringbone stitches for patterns.
Fix mirrors with special stitching techniques.
Embellish borders and finish edges.

title: Terracotta Craft
short: Clay-based craft used to make pots, figurines, and architectural panels.
steps: Prepare clay by kneading until smooth.
Shape clay into figures or objects.
Carve decorative details before drying.
Sun-dry the pieces to remove moisture.
Fire in a kiln for strength and color.

title: Longpi Black Pottery
short: A unique Manipur pottery made without a potter‚Äôs wheel using black serpentinite stone.
steps: Crush and mix serpentinite stone and clay.
Shape by hand or using molds.
Polish with leaves for shine.
Fire at high temperature for black finish.
Cool slowly to avoid cracks.

title: Thanjavur Dancing Dolls
short: Traditional bobble-head dolls made from terracotta or papier-m√¢ch√©.
steps: Mold body parts using clay or papier m√¢ch√©.
Assemble upper and lower sections separately.
Paint with bright colors and ornaments.
Attach weighted bases to enable wobbling.
Dry and varnish for protection.

title: Meenakari Art
short: Colorful enamel art on metal surfaces, used heavily in Jaipur jewelry.
steps: Clean and shape metal surfaces.
Engrave recessed areas for enamel.
Fill cavities with colored enamel powders.
Fire in a furnace to melt and fuse enamel.
Polish the final piece for shine.

title: Kondapalli Wooden Toys
short: Hand-carved toys from Andhra Pradesh using lightweight Tella Poniki wood.
steps: Cut and shape lightweight softwood.
Carve body, limbs, and details.
Assemble pieces with natural adhesives.
Paint with bright vegetable colors.
Finish with lacquer coating.

title: Sandalwood Carving
short: Exquisite carvings on fragrant sandalwood from Karnataka.
steps: Select high-quality sandalwood blocks.
Sketch outlines directly onto the wood.
Carve using fine tools for details.
Polish and smooth all surfaces.
Apply natural oil for shine.

title: Rogan Art
short: A rare Gujarati cloth art made using castor-oil-based thick paint drawn with threads.
steps: Heat castor oil and natural pigments to form thick rogan paste.
Stretch cloth onto a surface.
Dip a metal stylus into the paste.
Draw patterns by stretching threads of rogan from the tool.
Add final flourishes and allow to dry.

title: Pipili Appliqu√© Work
short: A decorative textile art from Odisha using cut fabric shapes stitched onto cloth.
steps: Cut colorful fabric pieces into motifs.
Position pieces on a contrasting cloth base.
Stitch edges using decorative stitches.
Add mirrors, tassels, or borders.
Finish by backing and trimming edges.

title: Sanjhi Paper Cutting
short: A delicate paper-cutting art from Mathura inspired by Vaishnav temple designs.
steps: Fold paper to ensure symmetrical cuts.
Draw intricate motifs‚Äîpeacocks, lotus, Krishna scenes.
Cut using fine scissors or craft blades.
Flatten and mount onto colored backgrounds.
Frame or laminate for protection.
